titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to abolish the electoral college and to provide for the direct popular election of the President and Vice President of the United States.

A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to abolish the electoral college and to provide for the direct popular election of the President and Vice President of the United States.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

term.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

bill.summary:
Constitutional Amendment
The President and Vice President shall be jointly elected by the direct vote of the qualified electors of the several states and territories and the District of Columbia.
